column4: you should at least specify fat32. In any case, that question needed more information.
no, you made the mistake, you go and do the research.
I don't care, as long as you don't spread misinformation
all you had to do was say a word hinting the right thing. I was going to research anyway, to verify your claim.
okay, I was being a bit harsh. Peace?
it's a good idea to dual boot between dapper and a fresh install of the latest
dapper happens to not support most of my hardware. but it works fine if i chose to work with a cripled system
does gutsy run well off the live CD, or is that frustrating, too?
the lack of persistence on the livecd isn't so useful
I'm asking because I was going to suggest a fresh install
my install is about a week old. i haven't used software from outside official repositories

i would've downgraded, but compiz works much better after the updates... leaves me in a fix.
